section.title: Overview
section.p: Rate defines the amount of currency to be charged for each unit of consumption by a call. For example, 0.05 United States dollars is charged for 1 SMS.

The rate entity defines the rating conversion parameters and the type of the resource allocated or reported. Rate is applied to a single unit type or type of consumption resource such as time, volume, and unit. It can define the type of resource or consumption for which it applies.
It is recommended not to change the rate/tax in between calls when the session is ongoing.
The rate entity allows service operators to define the following:

li.p: For example, the rate is expressed as 5 KB for 0.25 United States dollars. However, beyond this rate, it is important to identify the granularity of the charge. The granularity may be of a different quantity than that expressed in the rate. In this example, the granularity may be 512 bytes or 1/10 of 5 KB.
For example, 0.05 United States dollars for the first 100 MB, and 0.03 United States dollars after that.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: This section describes the parameters to define a rate charged against a call.

Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration > CHARGING tab and select Rates from the hamburger menu ( ). To define a new rate, click to add the basic details as described in the given table:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of the rate entity.
This parameter indicates the cost applied at the initial connection setup of the call.
This parameter indicates the unit in which the quantity and duration is specified within the charging steps.

entry.p: Select the required rate type from the predefined rate types in the drop-down list.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the unit in which the granularity is specified within the charging steps.

entry.p: Select the required granularity level from the predefined granularity levels in the drop-down list.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the security domain associated with the rate entity.

entry.p: Select the required security domain from the predefined security domains in the drop-down list.

sectiondiv.p: Rate to define a normal step type to charge 1 Euro for every 10 MB usage

li.p: For first 100 MB consumption, 1 Euro is charged per 10 MB usage.
For the remaining part of the call, 0.5 Euro is charged per 10 MB usage.

sectiondiv.p: Rate to define a normal step type to charge 0.25 Euro for every 10 MB usage for first 100 MB and then deduct the reflection cost = 1 Euro (in-between call); remaining call is charged with 0.05 Euro for every 10 MB usage

li.p: For first 100 MB consumption, 0.25 Euro is charged per 10 MB usage.
Reflection cost of 1 Euro is deducted, that is, for 0 duration and in-between the call.
For the remaining part of the call, 0.50 Euro is charged again per 10 MB usage.

sectiondiv.p: Rate to define a normal step type to charge 0.025 Euro for every 10 MB usage for first 100 MB and then deduct Fixed cost = 10 Euro for 50 MB; remaining call is charged with 0.50 Euro for every 10 MB usage

li.p: For first 100 MB consumption, 0.25 Euro is charged per 10 MB usage.
Fixed cost of 10 Euro is deducted for 50 MB.
For the remaining part of the call, 0.50 Euro is charged again per 10 MB usage.
